Description: Understanding the properties and equations of lines and circles in geometry.
The concept of ratios and proportions, their applications, and solving proportional problems.
Properties of quadrilaterals inscribed in a circle, including angle relationships and area.
Analyzing the equations of lines in the Cartesian plane and their relationships.
Exploring Thales' theorem and its applications in geometry.
Solving linear systems of equations using substitution, elimination, and graphical methods.
Understanding and solving systems of linear inequalities graphically and algebraically.
Understanding the properties of similar triangles and their applications in problem-solving.
Exploring the real number system, including rational and irrational numbers.
Understanding translations in geometry and the properties of vectors.
Working with algebraic expressions, their simplifications, and applications.
Studying trigonometric functions and their relationships in triangles and circles.
Applying coordinate geometry to solve problems involving lines, circles, and parabolas.
Understanding statistical methods and analyzing data from surveys.
Exploring the properties of 3D geometric solids, including volume and surface area.
